function: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
static_description: The main application shell with navigation bar, content area, and footer. Navigation includes links to Home, Contests, Leaderboard, Profile, and Admin Panel. Content area displays different views based on route.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on navigation links updates the URL and renders corresponding view components dynamically by fetching data from backend APIs.

function: A backend API server that connects to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
static_description: RESTful API endpoints served over HTTP at port 3001. Endpoints handle CRUD operations for users, contests, questions, answers, and scores. Middleware handles CORS, request parsing, and authentication checks.

function: User authentication and session management system
static_description: Login page with username/email and password fields, 'Remember Me' checkbox, and 'Forgot Password?' link. Signup page with full name, email, username, password, and confirm password fields. Both pages have submit buttons.

interaction_and_states.description: Submitting login form sends credentials to backend; upon success, stores JWT token and redirects to dashboard. Submitting signup form creates new account and logs user in automatically.
Clicking logout clears stored tokens and redirects to homepage.

static_description: Contests page featuring filter options above a scrollable grid/list of contest cards. Each card shows title, brief description, start time, duration, participant count, and an 'Enroll' button.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting filters triggers API call to fetch filtered results and updates displayed list.
Clicking on a contest card navigates to contest details page.

resource_dependency.enrollment_confirmation_modal: Modal dialog confirming successful enrollment with option to go to contest lobby.

static_description: Contest detail page with overview information including title, category, difficulty, schedule, rules, and an 'Enroll Now' primary action button prominently placed.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Enroll Now' makes authenticated POST request to backend. On success, displays confirmation modal and enables access to contest lobby.

resource_dependency.timer_component: Live countdown timer showing remaining time per question

function: Interactive question display interface for live contests
static_description: Full-screen contest interface divided vertically into question panel (top) and answer panel (bottom). Timer is visible near top right. Question text and options are shown in central area.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting an answer highlights selection. Clicking 'Next Question' saves current response locally and loads next question. Final question changes button label to 'Submit Answers'.
Clicking 'Submit Answers' submits all responses via POST to backend and transitions to score summary screen.

resource_dependency.answer_validation_rules: Required field check, format matching (for short answers)
resource_dependency.error_message_styles: Red bordered inputs with inline error messages below invalid fields

static_description: Answer input section below each question allowing user to enter or select response. Includes visual feedback indicators during submission processing.

interaction_and_states.description: Attempting to proceed without answering triggers validation errors beside respective inputs. Valid submissions are sent to backend endpoint for grading.

resource_dependency.score_calculation_logic: Backend logic calculating points based on correctness and speed
resource_dependency.live_score_update_mechanism: WebSocket connection pushing real-time score updates
resource_dependency.score_display_format: Numerical score with optional breakdown (correct/wrong/time bonus)

static_description: Scoreboard overlay appearing after submission or accessible throughout contest showing current user’s score updated instantly as answers are processed.

interaction_and_states.description: Receiving score update events refreshes displayed score value dynamically without manual reload.

function: Leaderboard showing user rankings and scores
static_description: Dedicated leaderboard tab/page presenting ranked list of contestants sorted by highest score then fastest completion time. Top three ranks highlighted visually.

interaction_and_states.description: Scrolling through long lists loads additional entries progressively via infinite scrolling technique.

resource_dependency.stats_visualization_charts: Bar chart showing category-wise performance; line graph for score progression

function: User profile page displaying personal stats and contest history
static_description: Profile dashboard split into sections: user info header, performance summary cards, recent activity timeline, and achievement badges gallery.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on individual contest entries in history opens detailed result view with question-by-question breakdown.

resource_dependency.admin_contest_management_crud: Create, Read, Update, Delete actions for contests
resource_dependency.admin_auth_check: Role-based access control requiring admin privileges

function: Admin panel for creating and managing trivia contests
static_description: Protected admin dashboard with sidebar menu listing administrative modules such as Manage Contests, User Management, Analytics Reports. Main panel shows tables/lists of entities with action buttons.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking Create New Contest opens multi-step form wizard. Save publishes draft/published versions depending on status toggle. Edit/Delete modify existing records directly.

resource_dependency.users_table_schema: id (UUID), full_name (TEXT), email (TEXT UNIQUE), username (TEXT UNIQUE), password_hash (BYTEA), created_at (TIMESTAMP)
resource_dependency.contests_table_schema: id (UUID), title (TEXT), description (TEXT), category (TEXT), difficulty (ENUM), start_time (TIMESTAMP), duration_minutes (INTEGER), created_by (FK to users.id)
resource_dependency.questions_table_schema: id (UUID), contest_id (FK to contests.id), question_text (TEXT), question_type (ENUM: mcq/tf/short), correct_answer (TEXT), options (JSON ARRAY)
resource_dependency.answers_table_schema: id (UUID), user_id (FK to users.id), contest_id (FK to contests.id), question_id (FK to questions.id), submitted_answer (TEXT), is_correct (BOOLEAN), answered_at (TIMESTAMP)
resource_dependency.scores_table_schema: id (UUID), user_id (FK to users.id), contest_id (FK to contests.id), total_score (INTEGER), completed_at (TIMESTAMP)

function: Database schema supporting users, contests, questions, answers, and scores
static_description: Logical grouping of interrelated tables modeling core domain entities. Relationships enforced via foreign keys ensuring referential integrity across contest participation flow.

function: Responsive UI design with beige as base color and saddle brown for components
static_description: Entire application styled consistently using CSS variables for base background (beige) and component accents (saddle brown). Layout adapts fluidly between device sizes maintaining usability and aesthetic coherence.

interaction_and_states.description: Adjusts layout breakpoints accordingly, switching between stacked mobile view and side-by-side desktop layouts while preserving consistent styling.

resource_dependency.install_all_script_command: "install:all": "concurrently \"cd client && npm install\" \"cd server && npm install\""

function: Package.json configured with npm run install:all for frontend and backend installation
static_description: Root package.json file containing script definition enabling simultaneous installation of frontend and backend dependencies when executing 'npm run install:all'.

resource_dependency.dev_server_start_script: "dev": "concurrently \"cd client && npm run dev\" \"cd server && npm run dev\""

function: Package.json configured with npm run dev for concurrent frontend and backend development servers
static_description: Root package.json script command launching both frontend Vite dev server and backend Node/Nodemon server concurrently under unified terminal output stream.
